sub_topic: Solving non-homogeneous systems of linear equations
message_1:
Given the system of equations:

$x_1 + 2x_2 - x_3 = 7$

$-x_1 + 3x_2 + 2x_3 = 8$

$2x_1 + 2x_2 + 3x_3 = 15$

Find the solutions for $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ using the method of solving non-homogeneous systems of linear equations.
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations, we can use the Gaussian elimination method. First, we will write the augmented matrix for the given system:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 7 \\
-1 & 3 & 2 & 8 \\
2 & 2 & 3 & 15
\end{array}\right]
$$

Now, we will perform row operations to get the matrix in row-echelon form:

1. Add the first row to the second row to eliminate $x_1$ from the second row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 7 \\
0 & 5 & 1 & 15 \\
2 & 2 & 3 & 15
\end{array}\right]
$$

2. Subtract twice the first row from the third row to eliminate $x_1$ from the third row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 7 \\
0 & 5 & 1 & 15 \\
0 & -2 & 5 & 1
\end{array}\right]
$$

3. Divide the second row by 5 to get a leading 1 in the second row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 7 \\
0 & 1 & 1/5 & 3 \\
0 & -2 & 5 & 1
\end{array}\right]
$$

4. Add twice the second row to the third row to eliminate $x_2$ from the third row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 7 \\
0 & 1 & 1/5 & 3 \\
0 & 0 & 21/5 & 7
\end{array}\right]
$$

5. Divide the third row by 21/5 to get a leading 1 in the third row:

$$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -1 & 7 \\
0 & 1 & 1/5 & 3 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & 5/3
\end{array}\right]
$$

Now, we have the matrix in row-echelon form. We can use back-substitution to find the solutions for $x_1$, $x_2$, and $x_3$:

1. From the third row, we have $x_3 = 5/3$.

2. From the second row, we have $x_2 + (1/5)(5/3) = 3 \Rightarrow x_2 = 3 - (1/3) = 8/3$.

3. From the first row, we have $x_1 + 2(8/3) - (5/3) = 7 \Rightarrow x_1 = 7 - (16/3) + (5/3) = 6/3 = 2$.

So, the solutions for the given system of linear equations are $x_1 = 2$, $x_2 = 8/3$, and $x_3 = 5/3$.
